But that's what she does to others. 

She's effectively a stat check champ. Not to the effect of Vlad, but a stat check champion nonetheless. Of course, that's true of most fighters. The ones that pass get played, and the ones that don't..don't.

Uh, stat check champions are champions that fight without much outplay potential - which generally implies point and click and no skills with varying effectiveness.
 
Fiora has a spell that can completely change the fight - her W. She has to time it well and hit it (which means it can be dodged) and as we already established hitting her vitals highly depends on positioning of both parties and her damage highly depends on hitting vitals. 

Example for stat check champions: old Vlad vs Shyvana - the one with the better stats wins 100%, outplays are practically impossible.

Definetely not a stat check battle: Riven vs Fiora, stats obviously matter but hitting the Fiora W and the vitals totally changes the fight.

Meanwhile the Riven dodging away from vital procs and baiting out the Riposte is also a great display of outplay potential from the other side of the fight.

Fiora's problem is just that the way she exists now relative to the majority of other champs in the game is not conducive to that kind of play and outplay (usually it's just how well the Fiora executes, especially against less mobile enemies).

If anything, the whole situation is indicative of the greater problem that there still *are* a lot of stat check champs in the game, and they're the ones that suffer hardest when facing a more modern design like Fiora's, and that's not the fault of Fiora, that's the fault of the outdated designs (as awful as that may sound, especially when that describes half my champ pool. RIP me...)

The real issue here is that her AS slow is out of place on her kit, just like it was on Lee sin before they removed it. It turns into an un-fun "Win more" situation, since she doesn't have to invest into durability to access it, nor is she a naturally supportish tanky champion (Nunu/Malphite), and Nasus gets to have his (which is categorically weaker until he ranks up the ability, even if it has a longer duration) because he *actually* struggles in most games early.

Uniqueness isn't always a good thing, and there is usually a reason for it *other* than the sake of being different (i.e. it shouldn't exist in whatever iteration it is).

Fiora's whole champion identity is supposed to be built around skillful play, and flat out reducing your opponent's ability to fight back is the opposite of that. Realistically (completely disregarding how this might effect her balance) her riposte should be much weaker outside of blocking damage or CC (e.g. nothing hits-> only deals damage, damage hits-> it slows (not AS), CC hits-> it stuns). 

Further building on the skillful play side of things, they need to tighten up how easily vitals can be procced, either shortening the range (especially dealing with people who dash through you to proc them, that shouldn't work) or adding something that the opponent can do to defend a vital *other* than simply walking out of her range (which leads to much less interactive play, the opposite of what it should be doing).

And it all stems from her passive. A stupid mini game that fiora FORCES you to play, with only one rule, fiora is the only one having any fun with it. There's no interactive counter play to it. You back off and reset a vital but come 6 that doesn't matter anymore.
The passive effectively zones you effortlessly. Fiora just has to be there and a vital will appear and you need to act accordingly to get a favourable one so u can farm a little.
Change the passive or make it punish fiora for not hitting vitals so a player can go "this vital is favourable for me, time to trade" as opposed to "FARMFARMFARMFARMFARMFARMFARMFARM shit the vital changed".

there isn't any real conterplay. protect the vitals? maybe if she had to hit them more than once and didn't have a dash and a slow that can both individually hit the vital.

Counterplay is the ability to do something that is realistically going to help defeat a champion. there isn't a lot of things you can realistically do against fioras true damage.

Counter-build: the art of using stats from items to take less damage after you've f'd up.

Counter-play: the art of taking action to avoid taking damage in the first place.

Point-n-click attacks and abilities have no counterplay because there is nothing you can do to prevent the enemy from clicking you - the damage is coming and can only be avoid if you have an ability that lets you block, dodge, or shield it. 

Abilities like Fiora's vitals do have counter-play because they do not guarantee damage - since Fiora's vitals do not do anything until she procs them you can know which direction she needs to attack from and stop her. Either wait for her to jump at you and CC her in the face (hit her mid-jump and you should catch her before she can W) or you can just change you positioning such that the vital is not near Fiora. You can even back off for a couple seconds to change the vitals location to one that is better for you.

is it real counterplay though, or is it an illusion?

In many cases dodging a skillshot is counterplay
Yasuo's q is a skillshot.
Dodging All of yasuos q's is not real counterplay.

Why is this the case?
In many cases dodging the skillshot means that you are eating the enemies resources, or you are lowering their damage threat for a while, and there is also a chance that you just mad them waste their primary engage/peel tool.
In yasuo's case dodging any individual skillshot means almost nothing, he isn't losing any resources, his damage output isn't getting lowered, and even when you do manage to dodge the tornardo he can still just build another one in a very short time.

Fiora is like the latter, dodging her vitals isn't real counterplay because she doesn't spend anything to use them. whether she hits a vital or not it doesn't matter in the long run to fiora, because she can just try again for free.

When you successfully counter someone in any respect the person countered should be in a negative position, rather than you countering someone and only putting them in an even position.


The unfortunate thing is that there are a lot of things like that which exist in the game, and it confuses players to what constitutes counterplay and what does not constitute counterplay.

You can't counterplay damage, you can only counterplay champions/their abilities. And in Fiora's case it's shutting her down early as she is squieshy and not too great in escaping ganks and afterwards forcing objectives by setting them up properly (visionlines) so that she must group with her team, rendering her essentially useless as her teamfighting sucks.

WIth that being said, Fiora has been performing very well for quite a while now so she is definetely on the strong side, but she does have her fair share of counterplay.

She is weak against poke, so I really don't think that she is that strong against Kennen and Jayce, she does indeed have a skill matchup against quite a few carries, although I think that she should dumpster Camille, while not really getting dumpstered by Renek and Jax.

I'm not far off at all when it comes to her match-ups, let me give you some analysis of what I think are favorable against fiora.

1. {{champion:80}}: By far the biggest counter to Fiora there is - he has endless poke to Fiora's squishiness, his stun is instant and his full combo can easily burst or chunk fiora down. There should be absolutely no way for fiora to beat this guy early on (especially with ignite) without any help from the jungler, she'll just be sitting under tower for most of the early and mid game.

2. {{champion:58}}: Another lane bully and another champion who bullies Fiora VERY heavily in the early-mid game. Like pantheon, his stun is instant, he has sustain which pantheon does not and his full combo can easily burst down a fiora. Paired with ignite, he can definitely kill her at level three. Being in melee range of this guy HURTS.

3. {{champion:23}} Laning against this guy is an absolute nightmare. Fiora might as well be a three ability champ because her riposte is completely useless (unless you somehow manage to parry his W). Early game RNG crits with a 5 second unkillable time, he can outduel a fiora any stage of the game and can even match with her in terms of splitpushing.

4. {{champion:24}}: Now Jax to some people is more of a skill match-up but from what I've seen, he can definitely out-trade fiora early to mid game and scales well into late game. His combo (or poke) which consists of various AA cancels are much superior to fiora's early trades. Most people think Fiora counters Jax because she can riposte his E but it's up to > JAX < when to re-activate it, he can easily bait out her parry and when he does, he can definitely kill her.

5. {{champion:150}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:126}}: Ranged and poke champs can easily abuse fiora's squishiness early game, and if she comes into melee range to trade - they will often have escape tools to kite back and poke her even more. 

6. {{champion:75}}: Battle for early game, whoever gets the snowball first will always be able to kill the other with ease since both are late game monsters. Nasus personally imo, has the edge with his infinite stacking and his wither drastically slowing fiora's attack speed and move speed as well as being instant cast.

7. {{champion:54}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:2}} are also favorable against Fiora.
Malphite has an attack speed slow, bonus armor, and steals movement speed from Fiora. His ult completely depends on Fiora's reaction time.
Poppy has a W which stops Fiora's dashes, putting them on a > 16 < second cooldown early game which is insane. Her Q does %MaxHP damage and her E can easily stun an unsuspecting Fiora.
Olaf has AS steroids, Q poke, lane sustain and extra armor/AD and can outtrade fiora early-mid game.

The rest of the match-ups are heavily skill based: {{champion:122}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:240}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:164}}
